channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

  • Description: 1. X-2024030505 SequenceEvent: Corrosive hazmat 5-gallon plastic jerrican of Zep concentrated purple degreaser was found leaking out of a small punctured hole at bottom of jerrican. DescribePack: Jerrican had a small punctured hole at bottom of jerrican resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote. 2. X-2024030510 SequenceEvent: Corrosive hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Zep industrial purple degreaser 1-gallon had loose lids resulted to leakage. DescribePack: Bottles had loose lids resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024030266
item.description:
Report X-2024030266

  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: Contents were leaking from under the cap of the 1-gallon jug in the box, even though the cap was on tight. The foil seal on the jug's spout, under the cap, did not stop the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

QA was quickly altered about the hazmat then removed from the loaders. DescribePack: The plastic side wall on the right side was punctured and caused leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package away from the vanline loaders

item.title: Report X-2024030380

  • City: ORLANDO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030380 SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One jug in the box was leaking contents from a loose cap. The box and both jugs inside were also leaked on and soiled by a damaged box of paint. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote. 2. X-2024030381 SequenceEvent: The jerrican was found damaged in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The jerrican was dropped onto a bolt on the floor, puncturing the bottom and causing contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The jerrican was placed upside down, with the puncture on top, into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024030201
item.description:
Report X-2024030201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged while being loaded on pre-load this morning into van. Pre-load employees coded the package a 36 and placed it onto a wooden pallet and transferred it to the Hazmat cage to be processed by Outbound. DescribePack: Package was dropped, causing the 5 gallon drum inside of box to break open from the bottom, resulting in a hole approximately 2 inches wide. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside of a hazmat bag next to the hazmat cage to avoid any further leaking.

item.title: Report X-2024021930
item.description:
Report X-2024021930

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/8/2024 at approximately 1930, Dangerous Goods Addministration received a call from Employee 3646681 at the hub facility in Miami, reporting condensation developing on the outside of a package. The shipment consisted of two cans classified as "paint" (according to the marking) packaged in dry ice. During inspection, the shipment built up frost on the outer packaging. Further investigation revealed that the package polystyrene lining was damaged, resulting in the condesation buildup. Additionally, one of the cans spilled due to an apparent damaged closure. The outer package does not appear to have UN Specification marking. The shipment has been rejected and is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver had completed his delivery of sulfuric acid into the customer's storage tank. The driver was rinsing the delivery equipment with water when a small amount of product was able to get inside his safety gloves. The driver sought medical treatment where he was treated and released.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in damage area leaking contents onto ground on 2/21/2024 at 20:00. Once package was discovered, it was immediately placed in a hazmat bag and taken to the damage hazmat cage to be processed. DescribePack: Approx 2 inch hole at bottom of 5 gallon drum inside of fiberboard box. package appears to have been dropped during transit. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: package was placed inside of a hazmat bag to prevent any further leaks onto warehouse floor.

item.title: Report I-2024030024
item.description:
Report I-2024030024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/15/2024, during the boarding phase of flight DL2019, a passenger's carry-on bag in the overhead bin went into thermal runaway. The Flight Attendants heard a"pop" and saw flames in the overhead bin at row 11. Flight Attendants initiated an evacuation using the jetway. Customer removed the bag from the overhead and stepped on it to extinguish the fire. The flight attendants were on their way to retrieve the containment bag/water. ARFF responded, determined multi loose Li-ion batteries and coins arched and started the fire. No fire extinguisher or 02 masks were used. The affected overhead bin has no damage other than smoke soot residue. No Flight Attendant or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report X-2024030288
item.description:
Report X-2024030288

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET BOX DISCOVERED DURING PRELOAD SORT. BOX BAGGED AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE. UPON INSPECTION, DISCOVERED THAT BOTTLES INSIDE BOX WERE LEAKINBG DUE TO LOOSE CAPS. BOX PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG AND SALVAGE DRUM AND PLACED INSIDE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS ON PLASTIC BOTTLES DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX PALACED INSIDE PLASTIC BAG AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE FOR INSPECTION.
